SENT.plain: A 20-year-old patient was born with epidermolysis bullosa and a severe, slowly progressive muscle disease
Skin biopsy demonstrated junctional epidermolysis bullosa
Muscle biopsy demonstrated degenerative changes with increase in connective tissue, fibre size variability, rods and cytoplasmic bodies, central nuclei

In muscle biopsy dystrophin, chondroitin unsulphate, chondroitin 4-sulphate, chondroitin 6-sulphate, heparan sulphate, collagen III, collagen IV and VI, laminin, and fibronectin were normally distributed

This is the first report of the association of a form of congenital muscular dystrophy with junctional epidermolysis bullosa and, together with the previous reports of muscle involvement in epidermolysis bullosa simplex and dystrophica, it suggests the existence of a syndrome characterized by the contemporaneous presence of skin and muscle involvement
